metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9639 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in oggenc in vorbis-tools 1.4.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted number of channels in a WAV file, which triggers an out-of-bounds memory access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vorbis-tools - 1.4.0-7ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vorbis-tools package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.0-7ubuntu1').
